Training course on “Long Term Care in EU Countries”. Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: XIX Conferenza SIEP Economia del capitale umano: Istituzioni, incentivi e valutazioni, Pavia (Italy)

European Commission 1st technical meeting on “Monitoring the Pension Systems”, Madrid (Spain). Title of the talk “Assessing adequacy and long-term distributive implications of the Italian pension system”.
Modelling Ageing Populations to 2030, London School of Economics, London
2nd General Conference of the International Microsimulation Association, Ottawa (Canada)
Winter Health Economists’ Study Group (HESG), London School of Economics, London
International Conference on Evidence-Based Policy in Long-Term Care, London School of Economics, London

ESRC Research Centre on Micro-social Change (MISOC) Workshop, Colchester, UK
European meeting of the International Microsimulation Association, Dublin (Ireland)
International Conference on Evidence-Based Policy in Long-Term Care, London School of Economics, London

European Commission Workshop “Tackling Pensions Challenges in Europe - Better policies through better modelling”, Brussels (Belgium). Title of the talk “Retirement, Participation rates and economic downturn in Italy: assessing the relationship through CAPP_DYN”
International meeting of the International Microsimulation Association, Canberra (Australia)
AIES Italian Health Economics Association, Venice (Italy)
European meeting of the International Microsimulation Association, Maastricht (The Netherlands)
Department for Work and Pensions, London. Seminar on “Disability costs and disability benefits for older people in Great Britain “ for DWP analysts & Policy makers
House of Lords, London. “Disability costs and disability benefits for older people“, hosted and chaired by Baroness Campbell of Surbiton
Health Surveys User Conference, University College London, UK

Department of Health, 5 January, London. “Attendance Allowance receipt and evidence of disability in the English Longitudinal Study of Ageing“
Italian national institute for social security (INPS), 20 April, Rome (IT). Seminar on “On the interaction between the social welfare & insurance-based components of the Italian pension expenditure“
Ministry of Economy & Finance, 27 May, Rome (IT). Member of the Italian national institute for social security (INPS) delegation for the OECD Economic Survey of Italy, Fact Finding Mission“

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Impact & Engagement activities: ‘Assessing Adequacy and Long-Term Distributive Effects of the Italian Pension System. A Microsimulation Approach’ (eds. with Mazzaferro C.), Final Report, EU-PROGRESS

Impact & Engagement activities: Contributions to ‘Par. 2.2 Costs and Impacts’ of the Andrew Dilnot Commission Report ‘Fairer Care Funding, The Report of the Commission on Funding of Care and Support‘. pp. 71-108 (with Wittenberg R., Hu B., Hancock R., Comas-Herrera A., Malley J. and King D.). Department of Health, London

Impact & Engagement activities: ‘Dynamics and inertia in the long-term care policies for older people in Italy’ (chapter II, Annual report INPS 2016), Italian national institute for social security (INPS), Rome.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: PREMIO IPOST: per la ricerca e lo studio (First Classified with Mazzaferro C.), IV edition
member of the Centre for the Analysis of Public Policies (CAPP), U. of Modena and Reggio Emilia

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Lecturer: Health Economics for PG students, U. of East Anglia, UK

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Research Fellow, Health Economics Group, U. of East Anglia, UK
Lecturer: The Economics of Disability and PG student mentor: Department of Economics Summer School for PG students, U. of East Anglia.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: ITALIAN MINISTRY OF WELFARE: Aspetti distributivi del sistema pensionistico italiano nella prospettiva del passaggio al sistema contributivo.
Emilia Romagna Region, ANCI-UPI: Tributi locali e distribuzione del reddito nei comuni dell’Emilia Romagna
EMILIA ROMAGNA REGION, ANCI-UPI: Tributi locali e distribuzione del reddito nei comuni dell’Emilia Romagna
Municipality of Modena: Valutazione dell’impatto distributivo sulle famiglie delle politiche fiscali, tariffarie e di offerta di servizi del Comune di Modena
ISFOL: Aspetti relativi all’impatto delle riforme previdenziali sulla popolazione in età tra i 50 e i 64 anni.
Carlo Cattaneo Research Institute: Rapporto sulle povertà in Italia
ITALIAN MINISTRY OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL POLICIES: Studio prospettico del fenomeno della povertà in Italia mediante la predisposizione di un modello di microsimulazione
NEW DYNAMICS OF AGEING PROGRAMME: Modelling Ageing Populations to 2030 (MAP2030)
NUFFIELD FOUNDATION: The role and effectiveness of disability benefits for older people (in collaboration with U. of Essex) £12k

DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND THE NUFFIELD FOUNDATION: Developing improved survey questions on older people’s receipt of, and payment for, formal and informal care (in collaboration with LSE and the National Centre for Social Research) £170k+£20k
AGE UK: Can older people afford to lose Attendance Allowance? (in collaboration with U. of Essex) £20k

EU - PROGRESS PROGRAMME: Assessing adequacy and long term distributive effects of the Italian pension system. A microsimulation approach (in collaboration with U. of Modena and Reggio Emilia and U. of Bologna)  220k euros

AXA RESEARCH FUND: How can private long-term care insurance supplement state systems? The UK as case study (in collaboration with London School of Economics, the Nuffield Trust and the U. of Barcelona)  300k

AUSTRALIAN RESEARCH COUNCIL: Financing aged care in Australia: mitigating fiscal gaps and maintaining intergenerational equity (in collaboration with NATSEM, U. of Canberra, U. of New South Wales, the Australian Institute of Health and Ageing) £13k

NUFFIELD FOUNDATION: Enhancing a dynamic microsimulation model for assessing the distributional implications of potential reforms to the UK system of financial support for older people with care needs. £14k

NUFFIELD FOUNDATION: Care and support of older people living in the community: understanding receipt of formal and informal care, payment for services, provision of informal care and their implications for policy (in collaboration with Personal Social Services Research Unit at London School of Economics and the National Centre for Social Research) £123k
ESRC: Disability and care needs in the older population: disability benefits, social care and well-being (co-applicant; in collaboration with U. of Essex, UK) £160K

2014-2019 ESRC: Business and Local Government Data Research Centre (in collaboration with Universities of Essex, Kent, LSE). Co-investigator in the “Support for Vulnerable People” research theme £5 million

NUFFIELD FOUNDATION: Care and State Pension Reforms (CASPeR) Project - Understanding the interactions between state pension and long-term care funding reforms in Great Britain (in collaboration with Personal Social Services Research Unit (London School of Economics), Pensions Policy Institute (King’s College)) £218k
EU - PROGRESS PROGRAMME: Wealth at Retirement and Savings Adequacy, WeRSA (in collaboration with Universities of Bologna, Torino and INPS). Role: Senior Consultant  20k

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: ITALIAN NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR SOCIAL SECURITY (INPS) : Individual Fellowship, type “A” visiting scholar research program:VISITINPS  18K
